summary: The Expanded Food Safety Investigation Act of 2025 grants the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) authority to conduct microbial sampling on concentrated animal feeding operations (CAFOs). This is to facilitate foodborne illness outbreak investigations, determine root causes, and address other public health concerns. The bill outlines conditions for access, coordination with other agencies like the Department of Agriculture, and clarifies its scope regarding food safety regulations. It also includes enforcement mechanisms for non-compliance with access requests.
